text: was a castle structure in Nagaoka, Niigata, Japan. Uesugi Kenshin spent his youth in the castle. ==History== The exact date of the castle's foundation is unknown but built in the Muromachi period. In 1543, Uesugi Kenshin left Kasugayama Castle and entered the castle as a joint commander by Nagao Harukage`s order. In 1544, Kenshin made his first battle against local lords opposed to Nagao clan in the castle and broke the siege. In 1548, Kenshin returned to Kasugayama Castle as a feudal load of the Nagao clan. 小野榮 米沢藩 現代書館 シリーズ藩物語 2006 P.64 The castle is now only ruins, with some earthenwalls, well and moats. ==See also== *List of Historic Sites of Japan (Niigata) ==References== Category:Castles in Niigata Prefecture Category:Historic Sites of Japan Category:Former castles in Japan Category:Ruined castles in Japan Category:Uesugi clan Category:15th-century establishments in Japan
